text:
I have some trouble with coverage (that should hit 100%) but doesn't.
I basically test a set of functions through an iteration over a vector (of functions).
So it is difficult to believe it is testing just a few functions in the vector.
I have no other call to those functions, so it can only come from that iteration.

Any idea on how to find why the coverage is going lazy? Is there some typical thing that the coverage cannot cover well ?

elements.text:
I have some trouble with coverage (that should hit 100%) but doesn't.
I basically test a set of functions through an iteration over a vector (of functions).
So it is difficult to believe it is testing just a few functions in the vector.
I have no other call to those functions, so it can only come from that iteration.

Any idea on how to find why the coverage is going lazy? Is there some typical thing that the coverage cannot cover well ?

text:
I think functions that are inlined are typically problematic. I see this often happen in type-parameter-getter methods:
```struct Foo{A} end
get_A(::Foo{A}) where {A} = A # <- often missed in coverage```
